definition[0]: to succeed in doing something in spite of difficulties
example[0]: Schindler contrived to save more than 1,000 Polish Jews from the Nazis.
definition[1]: to arrange an event or situation in a clever way, especially secretly or by deceiving people
example[1]: The lawsuit says oil companies contrived the oil shortage in the 1970s.
definition[2]: to make or invent something in a skilful way, especially because you need it suddenly
example[2]: In 1862, a technique was contrived to take a series of photographs showing stages of movement.
